title: Survey Methodologies for Social Scientists
text:
This is the github repository for the work-in-progress first edition of Survey Methodologies for Social Scientists.
The goal of this book is to teach you how to do create, conduct, and analyze surveys with R.


More to come!

title: 1  Introduction
text: This book is geared toward undergraduates learning survey methodologies. This includes, but is not limited to, the psychology of the survey response process; creating and disseminating survey questions; survey modes; sampling and weighting; ethics; and survey analysis and reporting.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 7  Survey Weighting
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: 7  Survey Weighting
text:
7.2 Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
